sentences.sContent: I was so certain that it had happened, that I wrote a letter to my parents that same night and put it in the postbox at the corner of the street.
sentences.sContent_eng: I was so certain that it had happened, that I wrote a letter to my parents that same night and put it in the postbox at the corner of the street.
sentences.sCn: 我如此地肯定这件事的发生，当晚我写信给我的父母，把信投进了街角的邮箱。

sentences.sContent: He feels the floor of the post office move beneath him, and he tries to turn his eyes from her, to ground his gaze in something solid: postbox, ceiling tile, window.
sentences.sContent_eng: He feels the floor of the post office move beneath him, and he tries to turn his eyes from her, to ground his gaze in something solid: postbox, ceiling tile, window.
sentences.sCn: 他感到邮局的地板在脚下移动，他试图把视线从她身上挪开，让他的注视停留在某种结实可靠的东西上：邮箱、天花板上的瓷砖、窗户。

trans.tranOther: a box in a public place, into which you put letters that you want to send
